{|{{Infobox ship begin |sclass=2}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[File:HKPF Police Patrol BoatNo.63.JPG|300px]] |Ship caption=Patrol Launch 63 entering the Cheung Chau Typhoon Shelter in 2008 }} {{Infobox ship class overview |Name=''Keka'' Class Patrol Boat |Designer=[[Australian Submarine Corporation|ASC Pty. Ltd.]] |Builders=[[List of shipbuilders and shipyards|Cheoy Lee Shipyard, Ltd]], [[Hong Kong]] |Operators=[[Hong Kong Police]] |Class before=Damen Mk1 |Class after= |Cost= |Built range=2000–2005 |In commission range=2002–2005 |Total ships completed=6 |Total ships cancelled= |Total ships active=6 |Total ships laid up= |Total ships lost= |Total ships retired= |Total ships preserved= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Ship type=Coastal patrol boat |Ship displacement=110 tonnes |Ship length={{convert|31|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= |Ship draught={{convert|1.8|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=CODAD: 1 MTU 8V2000M60 loiter diesel, 1 waterjet, {{convert|400|kW|bhp}}; 2 MTU 12V396TE84 main diesels, 2 shafts, {{convert|1500|kW|bhp}}; |Ship speed={{convert|27|kn}} |Ship range=1500 nm |Ship complement=13 |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament= |Ship notes= }} |} '''''Keka'' class patrol boat'''s are vessels designed by [[Australian Submarine Corporation|ASC Pty. Ltd.]] (formerly named Australian Submarine Corporation) originally for the [[Royal Thai Navy]] (3 vessels). A second variant series was designed for the Hong Kong Marine Police (6 vessels).
==Royal Thai Navy==
Australian company [[ASC Pty Ltd|ASC]] and Thai company Silkline International formed a [[joint venture]] to build three Keka Class patrol boats for the Royal Thai Navy at Silkline's yard at Pak Nam Pran, [[Prachuap Khiri Khan|Prachaub Krirkhan]], Thailand.<ref>{{cite web | title = Australian ship builder to build landing craft for Royal Thai Navy| url = http://www.pattayamail.com/298/business.htm#hd3| publisher = Pattaya Mail| accessdate = 2011-04-02}}</ref>
===Series T.81=== The Keka Class vessels for the Royal Thai Navy are designated as the T.81 Series and have the following characteristics:<ref>{{cite web | title = Royal Thai Navy Ship Specification; Thai Navy's warships| url = http://www.thaiarmedforce.com/inventory/51-rtn-ship-spec.html | publisher = Thai Armed Force| accessdate = 2011-04-02}}</ref>
* '''Displacement:''' normal load 95 tonnes; full load 110 tonnes * '''Armament:''' 40/60 Bofors; Oerlikon GAM-C01 20 mm, 2 x 0.50" machine gun * '''Main Engines:''' 2 x MTU 16V2000 TE90 * '''Radar:''' Anritsu
==Hong Kong Marine Police==
The Hong Kong Marine Police had a programme to replace 35 patrol boats that had previously been delivered between 1980 and 1992. The first to be replaced were the 'Damen Mk I' class for which the ASC designed Keka Class was chosen. They were built by Cheoy Lee Shipyards in Hong Kong and in their yard in mainland China between 2000 and 2005. They were ordered in two batches of two and four boats.<ref>{{cite web | title = Hong Kong (Hong Kong), The market – Australasia and East Asia | url = http://articles.janes.com/articles/Janes-Naval-Construction-and-Retrofit-Markets/Hong-Kong-Hong-Kong.html | publisher = Janes| accessdate = 2011-04-02}}</ref>
